Media notes: Microphone, on boom, inserted into the nest box hole to simulate the arrival of a parent. This stimulated the nestlings to begin begging vocalizations. Some say this sounds like a rattle snake. Physical inspection of the nest box revealed 4 nestlings. Other Behaviors: Beg. Equipment Notes: Me 62 with no windscreen.

Background Species: Junco hyemalis hyemalis/carolinensis -- Dark-eyed Junco (Slate-colored); Cyanocitta cristata -- Blue Jay
Locality: Columbia Street Park, Ithaca, New York, US

In-hand audio of a very ornery HY/FPF male YSFL.

Microphone, on boom, inserted into the nest box hole to simulate the arrival of a parent. This stimulated the nestlings to begin begging vocalizations. Some say this sounds like a rattle snake. Physical inspection of the nest box revealed 4 nestlings. Other Behaviors: Beg. Equipment Notes: ME 66 with foam windscreen.

Background Species: Setophaga pinus -- Pine Warbler; Spinus tristis -- American Goldfinch
Microphone: Wildtronics Pro Amplified Mono Parabolic Microphone

Media notes:
Male doing typical, low amplitude drumming from within and on the outside of nest box while female is away. Female arrives giving wicka calls, male comes out of box and flies away.
 Compilation of 2 recordings of copulations, ends at 1404hours. Other Behaviors: Bill Drumming. Equipment Notes: SD 702 HPF on at 80Hz, -12 dB/octave.

Locality: Columbia Street Park, Ithaca, New York, US

Microphone: Wildtronics pro parabolic microphone, mono, amplified
Media notes: Seen calling KLEER calls from top of an apple tree.  A high pass filter was used at 50 Hz.
Interaction calls as I watched 3 NOFL on the same tree

Female Northern Flicker at nest box giving loud series of long calls and a few quiet series of wicka calls. Female also does ritualized tapping from inside the nest box. Male was nearby and then flew off. Males does wicka calls in second cut.
 Ritualized tapping seems to be a signal to the other mate to come back to the nest box. There were many times during my observation of this pair when ritualized tapping was started by one member of the pair that was at the nest box alone and then the other member returned after a few minutes of ritualized tapping.
 Third and fourth cut, female doing long calls.
 Compilation of 4 recordings of copulations, ends at 1436hours. Equipment Notes: SD 702 HPF on at 80Hz, -12 dB/octave.

Locality: Road between Onion Saddle and Barfoot Jct
